Light to moderate snow will continue spreading across the region overnight, continue on Sunday, then come to an end from west to east Monday morning. A narrow band of heavier snow is expected to develop Sunday afternoon, roughly from northwest
entry.cap:areaDesc: Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Marathon; Oneida; Vilas

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 11 at 10:17PM CDT until March 12 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and freezing drizzle, with a light glazing of ice possible. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...Portions of east central Minnesota and northwest and west central Wisconsin.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 11 at 10:17PM CDT until March 13 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow, with some freezing drizzle possible after midnight. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Barron, Rusk, Dunn, Chippewa and Eau Claire Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 AM CDT Monday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Barron; Chippewa; Dunn; Eau Claire; Rusk

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 4:01AM EDT until March 12 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches with locally higher amounts in Western Greenbrier County. Up to one-tenth of an inch of ice accumulation. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and southeast West Virginia.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Greenbrier; Mercer; Monroe; Summers; Western Greenbrier

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 3:58AM EDT until March 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations around 1 to 2 inches. A glaze of ice to around one-tenth of an inch from freezing rain is expected along the ridges above 2,000 feet.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 3:58AM EDT until March 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulation of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze up to one- tenth of an inch. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett and Extreme Western Allegany

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 11 at 8:14PM EDT until March 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM SUNDAY TO 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow and light freezing rain expected. Total snow accumulations up to two inches. Less than a tenth of an inch of glaze expected especially in eastern Tucker County. * WHERE...Eastern Preston and Eastern Tucker Counties.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 12:28PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Park County about 12 miles southwest of Cody. The minor flooding caused by an ice jam is impacting areas from the 6Qs road Bridge near StageTrail road, south to just north of the junction of the 6Qs road and Southfork road.
